item.text: I am a founder of the [[Viral Academy]], where I teach a number of [http://david.viral.academy/view/welcome-visitors/view/david-bovill/view/courses Courses], and am aiming to include SFW in the toolkit we use.
item.title: David Bovill

item.text: I am a founder of the [[Viral Academy]], where I teach a number of [http://david.viral.academy/view/welcome-visitors/view/david-bovill/view/courses Courses], and am aiming to include SFW in the toolkit we use.
item.title: David Bovill

item.text: I'm pleased to participate in federated wiki happenings. I sometimes write a bit defensively about the wiki technology. I also have broad interests and will try to contribute here on subjects of interest to this community.
item.title: Ward Cunningham

item.text: We reflect on how ongoing development might be altered considering our collective experience these last two weeks.
item.title: Wiki in the New Year

item.text: Even simple things require a few steps in the [[Federated Wiki]] code. Here I remind myself how to get things done.
item.title: Coding Tips

item.text: A list of sites that document technology related to the [[Smallest Federated Wiki]]
This site contains information, tutorials, and practical examples that help you understand how to use and work with [[Smallest Federated Wiki]] in the [[Viral Academy]].
item.title: Viral Academy Orientation

item.text: The Viral Academy is an open distributed education project for offline and online group work. Our aim is to make online learning more social, personalised, and flexible.
item.title: Viral Academy

item.text: Paul Rodwell's thoughts, mainly, about the development of Federated Wiki.
item.title: fedwiki.rodwell.me

item.text: Paul Rodwell's thoughts on federated wiki hosted in the RedHat OpenShift cloud infrastructure. [https://github.com/paul90/wiki-openshift-quickstart github]
item.title: wiki-paul90.rhcloud.com

item.text: I teach digital writing and rhetoric at Bemidji State University, in northern Minnesota, US. I've been using and teaching with wikis since 2004.
item.title: M C Morgan

item.text: A coder, and curator on [https://github.com/fedwiki github], of fedwiki. I have a number of federated wiki sites, see [[Paul Rodwell's Sites]].
item.title: Paul Rodwell

item.text: The C0de Academy is a site where we collect and research topics related to code, programming and technology.
item.title: C0de Academy

item.text: Video is an important component of mobile and distributed teaching. We have developed techniques for running and creating [[Flipped Classrooms]] conceived as [[Live TV Studios]], and for embedding this content in collaborative environments.
item.title: Video in the Viral Academy
